heading.define: In HTML, heading tags are used to define headings or titles for sections of a web page. They are essential for structuring the content and providing hierarchy to the text. HTML provides six levels of heading tags, from

form.element: These are the building blocks that allow users to interact with the form and provide information. Here are some common elements: <input>: This versatile element creates different input fields depending on its type attribute. Examples include: text: Creates a single-line text input field.email: Creates an email input field with basic validation (e.g., checks for @ symbol). password: Creates a password input field where characters are masked for security. checkbox: Creates a checkbox for selecting one or more options. radio: Creates radio buttons for selecting only one option from a group.  <textarea>: This element creates a multi-line text input field for longer text entries.  <select>: This element creates a dropdown menu for selecting options from a list.
